story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a kind and gentle king named King Benjamin. He ruled over the kingdom of Aurelia with love and fairness, always striving to do what was right in the eyes of the Lord.

King Benjamin had a young son named Prince Caleb, who was soon to be ten years old. Prince Caleb was a curious and adventurous boy, always eager to explore the world around him and learn new things.

One night, as Prince Caleb was getting ready for bed, he asked his father, "Father, why do we follow the teachings of God?"

King Benjamin smiled at his son and said, "My dear Caleb, we follow the teachings of God because they guide us to live lives that are filled with love, joy, and peace. When we obey His commandments, we show our love for Him and for our neighbors."

Prince Caleb thought for a moment and then asked, "But Father, what happens if we make a mistake and disobey God's commandments?"

King Benjamin sat down on the bed next to his son and took his hand. "My dear Caleb, we all make mistakes sometimes. But God is always ready to forgive us when we sincerely repent and turn away from our sins. He loves us unconditionally, no matter what."

Prince Caleb nodded, feeling comforted by his father's words. "Thank you, Father. I will try my best to obey God's commandments and follow His teachings."

King Benjamin hugged his son and said, "That's my good boy. Now, it's time for you to go to sleep. Close your eyes and imagine yourself in a beautiful garden, where you can talk to God and feel His love surrounding you."

Prince Caleb closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep, feeling safe and loved in his father's kingdom. And from that day on, he made a conscious effort to follow the teachings of God and live a life filled with love, joy, and peace.

The end. Now, my dear son, it's time for you to close your eyes and imagine yourself in that beautiful garden, where you can talk to God and feel His love surrounding you. Goodnight and sweet dreams.
